title: Pete Doherty says he earns £10,000 a month as court bans him from driving
text:

Pete Doherty has opened up about his finances after he was handed a six-month driving ban in court this week.

The Libertines frontman, 40, takes home £10,000 a month - a whopping £120,000 a year.

He appeared in Folkestone magistrates court after he got caught speeding four times by the same camera.

Pete blamed it on a broken dashboard light as he claimed he couldn't see how fast he was going.

The musician was handed the ban and fines of £9,200 - £2,300 for each offence - after it emerged that he already had nine penalty points on his licence.

(Image: KMG / SWNS)

Pete hit the headlines in August 2018 for scarfing a 4,000-calorie fried breakfast in just 20 minutes .

He said he'd done so because he was "starving and skint".

Pete flashed the camera in Northdown Hill in Cliftonville, little more than a mile from his hotel home in Margate, Kent at the end of 2018.

On each occasion he was driving a 13-year-old VW Transporter van.

The camera first caught him speeding at 40mph on New Year's Eve last year and then at 38mph five days later.

(Image: Instagram)

The next day he was driving at 36mph, the same speed he registered for the final offence on January 20.

He was given four £100 penalty notices and three points on his licence.

But he was brought before the court when it was discovered the points would bring his total number on his licence to 21.

Pete, who represented himself, told the court: "There's not a lot to say, really. My dashboard had a faulty light and I did the best I could because I couldn't see the speed that I was doing, because it was dark. I was staggered when I got the first notice."

He also told magistrates he expected to be back soon as he'd recently been stopped by police while riding an electric scooter, which are currently illegal to use on UK roads and pavements.

(Image: Getty Images Europe)

The singer said: "I have a feeling that I might be back in here soon, because I bought an electric scooter and drove it down by the beach and was pulled over by two police officers.

"They had to go away on an emergency call but they gave me a notice and said I would hear from the court."

Chairman of the bench Andrew Henderson told Doherty he is banned from "piloting any propelled vehicle on British highways and roads for six months".

He added: "That means this electric scooter you mentioned as well."
description: The musician, 40, was handed a six-month ban and fines of £9,200 after he got caught speeding four times by the same camera
